thread.title: Liverpool's Divock Origi shows his class by hitting woodwork in training ground crossbar challenge
thread.title_full: Liverpool's Divock Origi shows his class by hitting woodwork in training ground crossbar challenge

author: Darren Wells
title: Liverpool's Divock Origi shows his class by hitting woodwork in training ground crossbar challenge
text:
Liverpool's Divock Origi shows his class by hitting woodwork in training ground crossbar challenge The Belgian international hit the target during training whilst preparing for Sundays match with Manchester City Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Origi hits a beauty in training ground crossbar challenge Share this video Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool's Divock Origi showed off his accurate shooting skills as he took part in a training ground version of the crossbar challenge on Wednesday. 
The Belgian striker was involved in the light-hearted competition with team mates Loris Karius, Emre Can and Lucas Leiva at the Red's Melwood training ground. 
Origi is no stranger to where the goal is having hit the net eight times in all competitions this season, despite not being a regular starter under manager Jurgen Klopp . Origi jokes around in training with Ragnar Klavan and Georginio Wijnaldum (Photo: Liverpool FC) Read More Liverpool's Sadio Mane hid the start of his football career from his own MUM 
He will be hoping his performances in training will give Klopp further reason to grant him a starting berth for the weekend trip to the Etihad where they face Manchester City in the Premier League clash. 
Much will depend on whether first choice striker Roberto Firminho has recovered from the injury which kept him out of Liverpool's 2-1 win at home to Burnley on Sunday . 
Liverpool go into the match with City with the best head-to-head record against the other sides in the top six, having notched up a total of 19 points out of a possible 27, including three in the 1-0 win in the reverse fixture between the sides at Anfield in December. Like us on Facebook
